item.title: Imperial Flush: Crane Co. Valves in Yemen and Saudi Arabia
item.dc:creator: Cristina Violante
item.description: In America today, showering daily is a social norm. We avoid body odor, grease, and sweat, and consider such qualities unhygienic or “gross.” We also consider the technologies behind the daily shower – bathrooms, sewers, and heating systems – and the parts that construct them – valves and pipes – to be commonplace. item.title: Cross-Pollination
item.dc:creator: Joy Garnett
item.description: I’ve spent the past few years organizing materials that were left behind by my late grandfather, Ahmed Zaky Abushâdy (1892-1955), the well-known Egyptian Romantic poet—and physician, inventor, and bee scientist.
